snippet: In the murder case of Jeffrey MacDonald and other legal cases that drag on for decades, the corollary of “attention must be paid,” is “interest will be lost, once you get into the facts.”
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Joe McGinniss describes interminable murder case against Jeffrey MacDonald, who has appealed for a new trial eight times over 42 years; contends case highlights glacial pace of federal appellate court system and its inestimable cost to taxpayers.
lead_paragraph: In the murder case of Jeffrey MacDonald and other legal cases that drag on for decades, the corollary of “attention must be paid,” is “interest will be lost, once you get into the facts.”

headline.seo: Court Cases That Drag On Forever
headline.main: Court Cases That Last Longer Than Some Lives
headline.print_headline: Court Cases That Last Longer Than Some Lives
